metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9455 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
In the Android kernel in the video driver there is a kernel pointer leak due to a WARN_ON statement. This could lead to local information disclosure with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9455` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-146-generic - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-4.4.0-146-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-4.4.0-146-lowlatency - 4.4.0-146.172

linux-image-4.4.0-146-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-146.172

linux-image-4.4.0-146-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-146-generic - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-146-lowlatency - 4.4.0-146.172
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-146.172').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1081.91').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').

linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1044.50').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1107.115').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-146.172').
linux-signed-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
